Reviews.Title: The T239 DOES vibrate
Reviews.Author: Mick
Reviews.Content: I'm looking at the Samsung T239 manual right now (pg. 60) and it certainly DOES vibrate.  The other reviewer is referring only to the alarm.  And while dedicated web and mail keys may seem unnecessary on a prepaid phone, where you wouldn't expect a lot of Internet access, this phone is also used with other types of T-Mobile plans.One other thing.  The product description has an error.  While text messages on T-Moble's monthly plans are $0.20 to send and receive, on the prepaid plans they are $.10 to send and $.05 to receive.  Go figure.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice for a basic phone
Reviews.Author: J. Burgoa
Reviews.Content: I had bought this phone a few months ago to replace my old nokia phone. I wasn't looking for something extravagant, just something basic. This phone pretty much suited my needs.Video and camera are all pretty much standard; nothing over the top. Some of the photos I shot came out a bit fuzzy but as I mentioned, I only wanted a basic phone. I didn't mind if the photos were not crystal-clear. However, the photos were not so blurry where you couldn't make out what was in the photo.Volume is my only complaint I have about this phone. If I'm in a very noisy place, a restaurant, city, or wherever, and I'm trying to listen to someone, even when I have the volume on the highest setting, sometimes it's still very hard to hear what the other person says. This gets very frustrating.All in all, I'm content with this samsung phone. People who are looking for a phone with a lot of extra features that some of the newer phones come with will not find much with this phone. Nevertheless, if you're looking for only a basic phone, this one will do the trick.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous phone - works like a charm
Reviews.Author: B. ROBINSON "Half English"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a phone--not an alarm clock or a camera or anything fancy--just a phone and it certainly fits the bill. It is easy to use, has a long battery life, and is easily one of the best cell phones I have ever purchased. Plus, the T-Mobile prepaid cell phone plan is saving me a fortune. I should have done this years ago.

Reviews.Title: A very customer satisfy
Reviews.Author: Kieon R. Whitford
Reviews.Content: It's better and has more future then the older model sidekicks *The only smart phone I've ever owned* Battery life is great, looks good, plays games, you could use your own music for ringtones *Take that Sidekick* camera is great *and it could Zoom unlike another phone I used* You could change the plan on this phone at any time, free web browser *only could look at some random stuff, sports, and news* the list goes on and on... GREAT PRE-PAID PHONE!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Cosby
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone (unlocked) to try while traveling rural areas and it gets good reception in areas that my previous phone (razor) would not. The battery life is really great and the sound quality is also good. No complaints here. If you need a phone that works, this one does it.

Reviews.Title: Decent cell phone....really
Reviews.Author: Alisa
Reviews.Content: This phone is actually decent to be inexpensive. The battery life is long. I think I just charged it once a week and that was it.I have dropped it countless times and it has been alright. What makes it nice is that it is still kinda in style with the slider thing going on.The only thing that I found sort of puzzling was the alarm system. With the older Samsung I had onced owned, I was able to set my alarm and actually turn off the phone. It would then turn itself on when the alarm would go off. That was really cool because I wasn't wasting the battery power while I slept. But with the SGH-T239, the feature for self alarm startup is not present. So when I set the alarm the phone has to be on all night wasting my battery life. Good thing it holds a good charge. I give it 3 stars for it's appearance, solid capabilities, and price.

Reviews.Title: Good little phone
Reviews.Author: Brandon K. Rush
Reviews.Content: It's too bad that this phone is no longer manufactured, because it's a nice, durable little slider phone. Samsung usually makes great phones, and this one is no exception. The sound quality is very good, the screen is bright, and the ringing speaker is clear and crisp. For $60 if you have T-Mobile, you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Poor reception
Reviews.Author: Leopard726
Reviews.Content: I seriously hate this phone with a passion.  I bought it on a special at a local store, but now I know why they had it on sale.  This phone has awful reception.  I'm lucky if I get a signal in a store.  My signal goes in and out and is unreliable.  If I had an emergency, I'm not sure I'd be able to use this.  I'm in the market for a new phone and I will NEVER buy Samsung again.  I prefer Nokia.  As soon as I get a replacement, this Samsung piece of junk is going to be chucked in the trash.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: AZKate
Reviews.Content: This phone was purchased as a replacement for the same phone I purchased in October of 2009.  The first phone has been great so I decided to purchase the 2nd to replace the 1st before they stopped making it.  Sound quality is great and has none of the annoying gadgets with todays smart phones.  Phone was delivered faster than I expected and I would definitely use the seller again.  Love the phone!!

Reviews.Title: company gets a 4 star, phone gets a 2
Reviews.Author: hiker
Reviews.Content: bought this phone expecting it to be a T-mobile phone and it was just an unlocked phone. Due to a mix-up with shippers orders I originally didn't get the phone and after waiting 3 weeks I finally contacted the company who did some research and adv me there was a mixup and they didn't get the phones they ordered (don't quite understand how that happened) so they offered to send me out the next model up from this phone or just cancel the order. I agreed to have the next model up sent out but was completely disappointed to learn it was an unlocked phone not a T-mobile phone as advertised. I will give the company props though for being so quick to respond and helpful when I first contacted them about the missing phone.  Tried to get this unlocked phone to work with t-mobile's extra servicecs (like the fave 5 circle) but no such luck.  I am sure it is a good basic phone, but I was expecting a T-mobile phone so overall am disappointed.

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: jerry riley
Reviews.Content: satisfied with phone functionality, delivery times , and overall service.I purchased another t239 for our second line and was less than thrilled with the phone construction. Batting .500 ...s/b 1000.

Reviews.Title: reliable phone
Reviews.Author: ifoughtthelaw
Reviews.Content: This phone will last a long time I have had mine for approximately 4 years, but I took a year break from it. So that is 3 years of daily use and the 1st and 2nd years I was a junior and senior in high school so it got a ton of use. I have kicked it, thrown it, spilled on by many different acholholic beverages. Sent thousands of texts and had some interesting conversations on it. It has chew marks from 2 dogs and 1 me. In all its a great phone. Unfortunately my girlfriend likes iphones and galaxy's and will eventually buy me one knowing I would never myself and I will have to get rid of it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung prepaid phone
Reviews.Author: sabrina
Reviews.Content: It was hard to find this phone as it has been discontinued. Lucky we found it. It always pays to check the internet.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS PHONE, SO EASY TO USE.
Reviews.Author: Betty Knudson
Reviews.Content: WHEN MY OTHER PHONE T239 QUIT WORKING I COULD NOT FIND THIS MODEL PHONE SO I BOUGHT THE SAMSUNG SPARQ AND I HATED IT.  I WAS SO HAPPY TO FIND MY OLD MODEL ON THE INTERNET SO I BOUGHT TWO OF THEM.

Reviews.Title: great phone!
Reviews.Author: CLTexans "GO TEXANS!"
Reviews.Content: This phone is awesome! I bought this as a Mother's Day gift for my mom since she doesn't really care for the whole "touch screen smartphones" This was a great gift for her and a great price as well. She loves the phone! Prompt delivery as well, Great service.

Reviews.Title: my cute phone
Reviews.Author: michelle edwards
Reviews.Content: it is cute and handy a bit old fashioned but i love it. it said it came with a battery and back cover but it didn't. Thank The One God I already had a battery!

Reviews.Title: Good simple phone....
Reviews.Author: BL
Reviews.Content: I wanted a phone similar to the one I had. By looks it was the phone, however, this one does not accommodate an SD card. That is the reason for 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: best phone ever
Reviews.Author: Owensangel
Reviews.Content: This is one of the savest phones out there.  When you talk on the phone the battery slips away from your head...keeping those cancer causing radio waves away from your body and brain.  The threat is real and the Samsung t239 is one of the best soultions!!

Reviews.Title: Read this review, its honest!
Reviews.Author: VictorUlloaUSA
Reviews.Content: phone was a nice upgrade from my razor, Phone does everything it claimes to do, However the quality is horrible, speaker is to loud and so is the ear piece, I find that the settings are difficult to adjust sometimes, and when i recieve txt's sometimes i dont hear it at all, but that could just be my settings,overall good phone, lacks alot of features new phones come with, even basic prepaid phones, but good phone. i suggest you look around though, i replaced this phone a month after buying it after switching from t-mobile to another company and got a basic smart phone with gps for free for only 50 bucks, cheaper lol.

Reviews.Title: Decent phone...until it died
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D. Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this in July 2010, and it worked fine for almost three months. Then slowly started deteriorating for no apparent cause (I hadn't dropped it or anything). First the 8 key started repeating, then the 2 key wouldn't work at all, then the D-pad started getting flaky, then eventually the power button only worked to answer a call and to turn the phone on, not to end a call or turn the phone off. Shortly thereafter the keypad died entirely.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad phone
Reviews.Author: Joesif
Reviews.Content: I replaced my old phone with this one and about six months later, it's still going strong (which is saying a lot because I tend to kill phones). The slider doesn't feel too cheap and the calls are perfectly clear. My biggest complaint is the camera. It doesn't take the clearest pictures, but for $50, I can deal with it.

Reviews.Title: love this cel!!
Reviews.Author: Dama
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a replacement for my t mobile and this phone is great! well for me (im not an electronic fan) so this one cover my needs with a camera and bluetooth. Its a good looking cel. and the price was fantastic. so far working fab.

Reviews.Title: Very good cell phone
Reviews.Author: cake-oh
Reviews.Content: This has been a great, inexpensive (bought on sale for $30 at Target) cell phone for my purposes.  The battery life is great.  The sound is good.  I agree with Alisa's review that it is unfortunate that the cell phone does not turn on in the alarm setting.  My one real complaint, however, is the lack of profile settings.  This phone replaces a cheaper $20 Nokia phone that had timed settings--for example, you could set the phone to be silent until a certain time.  This was extremely useful if I went into a meeting and did not want to worry about forgetting to change the setting back to normal.  It also allowed personal saved profiles with the combination of ring, vibration, etc. I wanted.  Other than that, I really do like the phone.  It locks automatically when closed... my husband sometimes has problems with his opening slightly in his pocket and making calls... but mine has been fine in my purse.

Reviews.Title: never again
Reviews.Author: shu
Reviews.Content: Second worst phone I have had.  The other was a Samsung also, several years ago.  Drove 80 miles to exchange it after only 2 days use.  The thing was so bad I guess I suppressed the memory of it.  Anyhow, when the evils of this Samsung T239 began to manifest themselves I decided to stick it out. But NEVER AGAIN SAMSUNG!Useless and annoying camera button on the side, turns on the camera and takes a picture every other time you grab the phone.Some other button rejects incoming calls, and seems to get pressed every other time I fish the phone out of my pocket to answer it.Can't use earbud and charge phone at same time; both devices plug into the same receptacle on the phone.Display of phone numbers in Call Log menu, font makes numerals 2,5,6,8,9 look the same.Couple of other useless and annoying buttons open up some screens having to do with greeting cards or something if pressed at the wrong time.Worst thing, living near the border, we got close enough to Mexico to get some of of those annoying unsolicited text message T-Mobile sends out.  For some reason these would not delete in the ordinary manner.  Took about a half hour to get the "you have a new text message" window off the screen.

Reviews.Title: Phone
Reviews.Author: RLong
Reviews.Content: Did not realize it was not text compatible.. Had to purchase another phone. definitely not worth the money that it cost!

Reviews.Title: Worst of the Worst
Reviews.Author: M. Payne
Reviews.Content: Samsung makes some pretty crappy phones but this has to be the worst of the worst. I needed a new phone without extending my t-mobile contract and this happened to be on sale (first sign to not get it).Problems so far:Falls apart easily (Back slides off and battery pops out)Bad sound quality (sometimes it sounds like your underwater or talking in a box)Random missed callsHorrible ReceptionOnly Pros:good battery life (very rare for a samsung phone)Bunch of other annoying stuff also.

Reviews.Title: Poor Bluetooth support, can't upload photos
Reviews.Author: ILikeToRead
Reviews.Content: I had an opportunity to help a neighbor with her "new" Samsun St-239 from T-Mobil.  It's her first cell phone.She like the fact that it had a camera.  She used it on a trip to California last week.  Today she asked me to upload her photos to her computer.You can't do it with this phone.  It does have Bluetooth but it is specifically not provided with any software that allows one to directly transfer (i.e. upload) photos to a pc or a Mac.So how do you get the photos out?  Per the user manual, you email them to yourself one photo at a time!  That's right, one photo at a time..You also can upload them to your Samsung MyAlbum somewhere on the web, but I believe that uses up some of your minutes.Anyway, my personal feelings is that this is pretty archaic.  My 5 year old Nokia 6102 flip phone uses Bluetooth to upload to pc's or macs.Plus the photos are VGA. Her pictures were grainy and fuzzy.  The camera and the lack of Bluetooth uploads makes this phone/service combo more than a bit out of date to me.

Reviews.Title: terrible phone!!
Reviews.Author: gigi
Reviews.Content: I have this phone now and I can't wait to get rid of it. It's been a year and a half since I got this phone and I'm waiting to get an upgrade. This phone doesn't help when your in boring places, I bought this phone on the computer and I should have looked into it more.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy - sound volume is very low.
Reviews.Author: Haydar Emre "Douglas Hatteras"
Reviews.Content: This is a well rounded phone but it has a big problem... You can "barely" hear the other side. And insult to injury, this stupid thing does not even have a "volume control" so you can increase the sound... I'm really applaud how it became a product ???Shame on Samsung.Shame on T-Mobil.Consumers should punish these companies for taking us granted...

Reviews.Title: nice phone dont like the button setup - alarm does NOT vibrate
Reviews.Author: jdogg
Reviews.Content: bought this phone and had to send it back. poor design w/ the shortcut button setup. the navigation buttons can not be set for user shortcut. when you slide the phone up theres a button only specifically for web (who uses web for this cheesy prepaid phone). also on the right there is a shortcut limited for only mail/text. why would they put this when their is already a shortcut for this on your navigation button? seems poorly designed.my BIGGEST complain is i used my cell phone for alarm and this phone does NOT vibrate and the sound is really LOW. you can barely here it. sent it back and got the nokia 1680 instead. a way better phone with lots of shortcut options.

ProductInfo.Features:
Compact slider phone for voice communication as well as text and instant messaging
Pay for just the minutes you use with no annual contract--easy refill via Internet or prepaid cards
VGA camera for still photos; Bluetooth for handsfree devices; personal organizer tools
Up to 6 hours of talk time, up to 336 hours (14 days) of standby time
What's in the Box: handset, battery, charger, wired handsfree headset, getting started guide, user manual (English/Spanish)
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung t239 Prepaid Phone, Charcoal (T-Mobile)
